TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebMethodAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class WebMethodAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class WebMethodAttribute sealed : Attribute

summary.span: 加入這個屬性 (Attribute) 至使用 ASP.NET 建立的 XML Web Service 內的方法，使該方法可從遠端 Web 用戶端呼叫。

span.span: Adding this attribute to a method within an XML Web service created using ASP.NET makes the method callable from remote Web clients.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在類別內有設定此屬性的方法被呼叫 XML Web service 方法。Methods within a class that have this attribute set are called XML Web service methods. 方法和類別必須是公用和 ASP.NET Web 應用程式內執行。The method and class must be public and running inside an ASP.NET Web application. ## Examples 在下面的方法範例`GetMachineName`可以跨 Web、 從遠端呼叫，因為它有。In the example below the method `GetMachineName` can be remotely called across the Web, because it has a . `GetUserName` 無法呼叫，遠端電腦上，因為它沒有，即使它是`public`。`GetUserName` cannot be called remotely, because it does not have a , even though it is `public`.

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Web 服務呼叫只能在交易中，由於 HTTP 通訊協定的無狀態性質的根目錄。A web service call can only be the root of a transaction, due to the stateless nature of the HTTP protocol. 這表示下列兩項設定是相等的每次呼叫建立新的交易：This means that the following two settings are equivalent, with each call creating a new transaction: ``` [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Required)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.RequiresNew)] ``` 這也表示所有的下列設定是相等的;這表示任何交易的支援：It also means that all the following settings are equivalent; meaning no transaction support: ``` [WebMethod] // TransactionOption.Disabled is the default [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Disabled)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.NotSupported)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.Supported)] ```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool enableSession, valuetype System.Web.Services.TransactionOption transactionOption) cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks Web 服務呼叫只能在交易中，由於 HTTP 通訊協定的無狀態性質的根目錄。A web service call can only be the root of a transaction, due to the stateless nature of the HTTP protocol. 這表示下列兩項設定是相等的每次呼叫建立新的交易：This means that the following two settings are equivalent, with each call creating a new transaction: ``` [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Required)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.RequiresNew)] ``` 這也表示所有的下列設定是相等的;這表示任何交易的支援：It also means that all the following settings are equivalent; meaning no transaction support: ``` [WebMethod] // TransactionOption.Disabled is the default [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Disabled)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.NotSupported)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.Supported)] ```

public: property bool BufferResponse { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.BufferResponse : bool with get, set

summary.span: 取得或設定這個要求的回應是否緩衝。

span.span: Gets or sets whether the response for this request is buffered.

value.span: 如果緩衝這個要求的回應，則為 ，否則為 。

span.span: if the response for this request is buffered; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 設定至`true`，將 XML Web service 方法的回應序列化為記憶體緩衝區，直到回應已完全序列化，或在緩衝區已滿。Setting to `true`, serializes the response of the XML Web service method into a memory buffer until either the response is completely serialized or the buffer is full. 一旦經過緩衝處理回應，它會透過網路傳回至 XML Web service 用戶端。Once the response is buffered, it is returned to the XML Web service client over the network. 當是`false`，XML Web service 方法的回應傳送回用戶端會在序列化。When is `false`, the response to the XML Web service method is sent back to the client as it is serialized. 一般情況下，您只想要設定至`false`，如果它已知的 XML Web 服務方法傳回用戶端的大量資料。In general, you only want to set to `false`, if it is known that an XML Web service method returns large amounts of data to the client. 資料量較少，XML Web 服務效能是透過更趨完美至`true`。For smaller amounts of data, XML Web service performance is better with to `true`. 當是`false`，XML Web service 方法的 SOAP 擴充功能已停用。When is `false`, SOAP extensions are disabled for the XML Web service method. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例會設定屬性設`false`和處理文字檔案傳回給用戶端的串流。The following code example sets the property to `false` and handles the streaming of a text file back to the client. 在程式碼範例示範如何串流處理大型的一種資料傳回給用戶端使用的類別，實作介面。The code example demonstrates how to stream a large piece of data back to the client using a class that implements the interface.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int CacheDuration { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.CacheDuration : int with get, set

summary.span: 取得或設定回應保留在快取中應有的秒數。

span.span: Gets or sets the number of seconds the response should be held in the cache.

value.span: 秒數，為應該保留在快取中的回應。

span.span: The number of seconds the response should be held in the cache.

value.span: 預設值為 0，這表示沒有快取回應。

span.span: The default is 0, which means the response is not cached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 當已啟用快取要求和回應會保留在記憶體中的伺服器上至少快取持續時間因此必須使用注意，如果您預期會有大量的要求或回應，或者您預期大不相同的要求。When caching is enabled requests and responses are held in memory on the server for at least the cache duration so caution must be used if you expect requests or responses to be very large or you expect requests to vary widely. 有兩個問題會影響 ASP.NET 2.0 Web 服務應用程式中的輸出快取。There are two issues that can affect output caching in an ASP.NET 2.0 Web service application. 在 ASP.NET 2.0 中，測試頁的 HTTP 方法已從 GET 變更為 POST。In ASP.NET 2.0 the HTTP method of the test page has changed from GET to POST. 但是，POST 通常不會快取。However, POSTs are not normally cached. 如果在 ASP.NET 2.0 Web 服務應用程式中將測試頁變更為使用 GET，快取就可以正確運作。If you change the test page in an ASP.NET 2.0 Web service application to use GET, caching works properly. 另外，表示使用者代理程式 (瀏覽器或呼叫應用程式) 的 HTTP 應該能夠透過將 "Cache-Control" 設定為 "no-cache" 以覆寫伺服器快取。In addition, HTTP indicates that a user agent (the browser or calling application) should be able to override server caching by setting the "Cache-Control" to "no-cache". 因此，當 ASP.NET 應用程式發現 "no-cache" 標頭時，便會忽略快取的結果。ASP.NET applications, therefore, ignore cached results when they find a "no-cache" header. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫的結果`ServiceUsage`快取中 60 秒的 XML Web service 方法。The following example places the result of the call to the `ServiceUsage` XML Web service method in the cache for 60 seconds. XML Web service 用戶端執行，隨時`ServiceUsage`XML Web service 方法，在這段期間，會傳回相同的結果。Any time an XML Web service client executes the `ServiceUsage` XML Web service method during that time, the same result is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Description { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Description : string with get, set

summary.span: 描述訊息，描述 XML Web Service 方法。

span.span: A descriptive message describing the XML Web service method.

value.span: 描述訊息，描述 XML Web Service 方法。

span.span: A descriptive message describing the XML Web service method.
The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 描述的訊息會顯示的 XML Web service 的潛在取用者，當產生 XML Web service 的描述文件時，例如服務描述和服務說明網頁。The descriptive message is displayed to prospective consumers of the XML Web service when description documents for the XML Web service are generated, such as the Service Description and the Service help page. ## Examples 在下列範例中，字串`Obtains the Server Computer Name`用來描述 XML Web service 方法的服務描述和服務說明頁面中的 XML Web service。In the example below, the string `Obtains the Server Computer Name` is used to describe the XML Web service method in the Service Description and Service help page for the XML Web service.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnableSession { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.EnableSession : bool with get, set

summary.span: 指示是否啟用 XML Web Service 方法的工作階段狀態。

span.span: Indicates whether session state is enabled for an XML Web service method.

value.span: 如果啟用 XML Web Service 方法的工作階段狀態，則為 。

span.span: if session state is enabled for an XML Web service method.
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要將工作階段狀態儲存在 asp.net物件、 XML Web service 必須繼承自並套用至 XML Web service 方法，設定屬性設`true`。In order to store session state in the ASP.NET object, the XML Web service must inherit from and a applied to the XML Web service method, setting the property to `true`. 如果 XML Web service 方法不需要工作階段狀態，然後停用可能會改善效能。If session state is not needed for an XML Web service method, then disabling it may improve performance. 將 XML Web service 用戶端唯一識別由 XML Web service 所傳回的 HTTP cookie 中。An XML Web service client is uniquely identified by an HTTP cookie returned by an XML Web service. 為了讓 XML Web service 用戶端的維護工作階段狀態，用戶端必須保存 cookie。In order for an XML Web service to maintain session state for a client, the client must persist the cookie. 用戶端可以藉由建立的新執行個體接收的 HTTP cookie並指派，之前呼叫 XML Web service 方法之 proxy 類別的屬性。Clients can receive the HTTP cookie by creating a new instance of and assigning that to the property of the proxy class before calling the XML Web service method. 如果您需要維護以外的工作階段狀態，當 proxy 類別執行個體超出範圍時，用戶端必須保存呼叫 XML Web service 之間的 HTTP cookie。If you need to maintain session state beyond when the proxy class instance goes out of scope, the client must persist the HTTP cookie between calls to the XML Web service. 比方說，Web Form 用戶端時，可以儲存所保存的 HTTP cookie在它自己的工作階段狀態。For instance, a Web Forms client can persist the HTTP cookie by saving the in its own session state. 因為並非所有的 XML Web service 使用工作階段狀態，因此用戶端不一定需要使用的用戶端 proxy 的屬性，XML Web 服務的文件應該指明是否會使用工作階段狀態。Because not all XML Web services use session state and thus clients are not always required to use the property of a client proxy, the documentation for the XML Web service should state whether session state is used. ## Examples 下例使用工作階段狀態，以判斷多少次特定的工作階段存取 XML Web service 方法`SessionHitCounter`。The example below uses session state to determine how many times a particular session accesses the XML Web service method `SessionHitCounter`. 下列程式碼範例是使用工作階段狀態的 XML Web service 的 Web Form 用戶端。The following code example is a Web Forms client of an XML Web service that uses session state. 用戶端持續存在的唯一識別工作階段，將它儲存在用戶端的工作階段狀態的 HTTP cookie。The client persists the HTTP cookie that uniquely identifies the session by storing it in the client's session state. [!code-aspx-csharp[HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer/CS/serverusageclientcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer/VB/serverusageclientvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ MessageName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.MessageName : string with get, set

summary.span: 在 XML Web Service 方法中傳遞並傳回的資料中，XML Web Service 方法所使用的名稱。

span.span: The name used for the XML Web service method in the data passed to and returned from an XML Web service method.

value.span: 在對 XML Web Service 方法來回傳遞的資料中，XML Web Service 方法所使用的名稱。

span.span: The name used for the XML Web service method in the data passed to and from an XML Web service method.

value.span: 預設值為 XML Web Service 方法的名稱。

span.span: The default is the name of the XML Web service method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性可用於別名方法或屬性的名稱。The property can be used to alias method or property names. 最常見的用法屬性會唯一識別多型方法。The most common use of the property will be to uniquely identify polymorphic methods. 根據預設，設為 XML Web service 方法的名稱。By default, is set to the name of the XML Web service method. 因此，如果 XML Web service 會包含具有相同名稱的兩個或多個 XML Web service 方法，您可以透過唯一識別個別的 XML Web service 方法設定內 XML Web service，而不需要變更的名稱是唯一的名稱在程式碼中的實際方法名稱。Therefore, if an XML Web service contains two or more XML Web service methods with the same name, you can uniquely identify the individual XML Web service methods by setting the to a name unique within the XML Web service, without changing the name of the actual method name in code. 資料傳遞至 XML Web service 時就會傳送要求中，並傳回回應中傳送。When data is passed to an XML Web service it is sent in a request and when it is returned it is sent in a response. 在要求和回應，用於 XML Web service 方法的名稱是其屬性。Within the request and response, the name used for the XML Web service method is its property. 對 XML Web service 方法相關聯的訊息名稱必須是唯一的 XML Web service 內。The message name associated with an XML Web service method must be unique within the XML Web service. 如果用戶端會呼叫原始方法之後加入新的 XML Web service 方法具有相同名稱但不同的參數，不同的訊息指定的名稱應該是新方法，但應在以確保相容性，保留原始的訊息名稱現有的用戶端。If a new XML Web serivce method with the same name but different parameters is added after clients are calling the original method, a different message name should be specified for the new method but the original message name should be left as is to ensure compatability with existing clients. ## Examples 在下列範例中，用來區分兩者`Add`方法。In the example below, is used to disambiguate the two `Add` methods.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionOption TransactionOption { System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionOption get(); void set(System::EnterpriseServices::TransactionOption value); };

summary.span: 指示 XML Web Service 方法的交易支援。

span.span: Indicates the transaction support of an XML Web service method.

value.span: XML Web Service 方法的交易支援。

span.span: The transaction support of an XML Web service method.
The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks XML Web service 方法只可以做的根物件，在交易中，由於 HTTP 通訊協定的無狀態性質。XML Web service methods can only participate as the root object in a transaction, due to the stateless nature of the HTTP protocol. XML Web service 方法可以叫用 XML Web service 方法中，相同的交易中，參與的 COM 物件，如果 COM 物件標記為 元件服務系統管理工具中的交易內執行。XML Web service methods can invoke COM objects that participate in the same transaction as the XML Web service method, if the COM object is marked to run within a transaction in the Component Services administrative tool. 如果使用 XML Web service 方法屬性`Required`或`RequiresNew`叫用另一個 XML Web service 方法與屬性`Required`或`RequiresNew`，在它自己所參與的每個 XML Web service 方法交易，因為 XML Web service 方法只可做為根物件，在交易中。If an XML Web service method with a property of `Required` or `RequiresNew` invokes another XML Web service method with a property of `Required` or `RequiresNew`, each XML Web service method participates in its own transaction, because an XML Web service method can only act as the root object in a transaction. |項目Item|描述Description| |----------|-----------------| |已停用Disabled|表示 XML Web service 方法不會執行的交易範圍內。Indicates that the XML Web service method does not run within the scope of a transaction. 當處理要求時，XML Web service 方法會執行沒有交易。When a request is processed, the XML Web service method is executed without a transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.Disabled`)][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.Disabled`)]| |NotSupportedNotSupported|表示 XML Web service 方法不會執行的交易範圍內。Indicates that the XML Web service method does not run within the scope of a transaction. 當處理要求時，XML Web service 方法會執行沒有交易。When a request is processed, the XML Web service method is executed without a transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.NotSupported`)][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.NotSupported`)]| |支援Supported|表示 XML Web service 方法不會執行的交易範圍內。Indicates that the XML Web service method does not run within the scope of transactions. 當處理要求時，XML Web service 會建立不使用交易。When a request is processed, the XML Web service is created without a transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.Supported`)][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.Supported`)]| |必要Required|表示 XML Web service 方法需要的交易。Indicates that the XML Web service method requires a transaction. 因為 XML Web service 方法只可以做的交易中的根物件，則會建立新的交易，XML Web service 方法。Since XML Web service methods can only participate as the root object in a transaction, a new transaction will be created for the XML Web service method.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.Required`)][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.Required`)]| |RequiresNewRequiresNew|表示 XML Web service 方法需要新的交易。Indicates that the XML Web service method requires a new transaction. 當處理要求時，XML Web service 會建立新的交易內。When a request is processed, the XML Web service is created within a new transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.RequiresNew`)][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.RequiresNew`)]| 如果從擲回例外狀況，或不會攔截對 XML Web service 方法，也會自動中止交易。If an exception is thrown from or not caught by an XML Web service method, the transaction is automatically aborted. 如果沒有發生例外狀況除非明確地呼叫方法，會自動認可交易`SetAbort`。If no exceptions occur the transaction is automatically committed unless the method explicitly calls `SetAbort`. ## Examples 下列範例開始新交易時`Transfer`呼叫方法。The example below begins a new transaction when the `Transfer` method is called.
